channel.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
channel.description:
Rate if you like and any comments (positive or negative) are appreciated. Post some things that you think I could improve also.
Thanks!
[URL=http://img144.imageshack.us/my.php?image=tankonoceanmv5.png][IMG]http://img144.imageshack.us/img144/758/tankonoceanmv5.th.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:2, topic:113516”]The reflection of your name is done wrong. and the reflection of the water looks really really bad…

The mark on the sand doesn’t reflect if the sand itself doesn’t… and the whole tank is not suppose to reflect only the top part of it…[/quote]
Oh… I thought that was glass… its too… Straight (o.O How do you spell that?)

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Hmmm… It might look better if it was flat and not slanted. Just because us humans like it like that cos the perspective is much easier to understand.

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @haroldsky haroldsky
item.description:
@haroldsky wrote:

not bad for a first time

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @skys_shadow skys shadow
item.description:
@skys_shadow wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:5, topic:113516”]Skys, do you notice the distance of the tank from the water? That distance cuts of parts of the reflection, if you move the reflection to the sands edge cutting off the bottom part - it look would better. The brown marking in the water should not be there - Its flat on the ground making no reflection.

Edit: Try not to make your name/text so over sized, thats not what you want the people to look at, the name. You want them to pay attention to the tank, but the name draws attention.

P.S. Don’t call everything a signature, this is obviously not a signature, it is a piece of art, call it something like that instead of a signature every time, signature isn’t art - Its something saying ‘Yo, I’m -----’[/quote]

Thanks for clarifying what fastbawlz said and for the name advice. I’ll take that into consideration next time. I’ll see what I can do about movning the reflection towards the sand more. And about shrinking the name

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

He just has his perspective off a little.

The angle that the tank is at in comparison to the water is off, and needs some adjusting, as well as the reflection in the water.

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Skys, do you notice the distance of the tank from the water? That distance cuts of parts of the reflection, if you move the reflection to the sands edge cutting off the bottom part - it look would better. The brown marking in the water should not be there - Its flat on the ground making no reflection.

Edit: Try not to make your name/text so over sized, thats not what you want the people to look at, the name. You want them to pay attention to the tank, but the name draws attention.

P.S. Don’t call everything a signature, this is obviously not a signature, it is a piece of art, call it something like that instead of a signature every time, signature isn’t art - Its something saying ‘Yo, I’m -----’

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach

item.title: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
item.dc:creator: @skys_shadow skys shadow
item.description:
@skys_shadow wrote:

Thanks for the feedback, both of you.

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:2, topic:113516”]The reflection of your name is done wrong. and the reflection of the water looks really really bad…

The mark on the sand doesn’t reflect if the sand itself doesn’t… and the whole tank is not suppose to reflect only the top part of it…[/quote]

Fastbawlz, I understand that you are saying about the sand mark in the water, but I don’t know what you are saying about only the top of the tank being in the reflection. Also, my name wasn’t supposed to be a reflection, I just put a shadow on it.

Read full topic
item.source: First CS3 sig, a tank on the beach
